Text.Value: Shh. It's all right.
*The wolf's fur bristles. He wants to jump, wants to bite.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: Wolf combat idle, bark a little bit (WilsonLee)

Text.Value: Relax. No one is here to hurt you.
Go boy. Chase!
*Snarl!*
Sit next to him, murmuring softly while avoiding eye contact.
*He snarls a warning, flattening his ears and lowering his body, ready to pounce.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: *DUPE* [Wolf] Lowers his body, preparing to pounce - Matt

Text.Value: *A low growl builds in his throat as his eyes track the movement of your tail. It's agitating him.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Wolf] combat idle then look down to [Player] tail (WilsonLee)
EditorData.NodeContext: Detecting the wolf's severe frustration - it's like a dog straining at a chain, wanting to attack. The chain isn't real; it's the obedience the animal has been taught but that goes against its instincts

Text.Value: Leave.
*The wolf bares his teeth; he doesn't take orders from you. He would chase you down, if not for his master.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Picking up a warning, but not of imminent attack - the wolf is telling us to back off

Text.Value: *Whine.*

EditorData.NodeContext: We're detecting the tranquil mood of a formerly aggressive wolf that we managed to calm. It's living in a druid grove, among people, and is now in an almost meditative state. Formerly it was irritate and close to violence.

Text.Value: Try to get closer.
Shh, I won't hurt you.
*His ears twitch as you speak, but his eyes don't shift from your tail. He sees you as a threat.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Wolf] Ears twitching, but watching [Player's] tail - Matt
EditorData.NodeContext: Picking up a warning, but not of imminent attack - the wolf is telling us to back off. Emphasis on 'threat'.

Text.Value: Leave. You are not wanted here.

EditorData.NodeContext: Rath is the wolf's master - the wolf wants to chase some children, to bite them. We've tried to order it not to do that but it won't listen to us and is warning us to stay away

Text.Value: *His eyes dart back and forth as he sniffs the air. He can't see them anymore, but he can smell them. Many, many strangers.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Wolf] 's eyes darts around while it's head facing up sniffing(WilsonLee)
EditorData.NodeContext: Detecting the wolf's severe frustration - it's like a dog straining at a chain, wanting to attack. The chain isn't real; it's the obedience the animal has been taught but that goes against its instincts

Text.Value: Leave.
*His ears twitch as he lowers his head down into your lap.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] sits down next to the [wolf]. [Wolfs] ears twitch and he lowers his head into the players lap - Matt
EditorData.NodeContext: A reflection on the calming of an aggressive wolf. A happy, calm moment.

Text.Value: *Growl.*
Try to get closer.
I just wanted to give you my smell. I'll leave you be.
Stupid or a liar. Neither is needed here. Go!
Leave.
*Growl.*
*The wolf focuses on you, calmed in your presence.*

EditorData.NodeContext: We're detecting the tranquil mood of a formerly aggressive wolf that we managed to calm. It's living in a druid grove, among people, and is now in an almost meditative state. Formerly it was irritate and close to violence.

Text.Value: Who's been pestering you? I'll teach them a lesson.
Silence. Your help is not required. Not by me, at least.
Down, boy.
Another stranger come to vex me. What will you do? Hunt me? Grab my tail? Shout until my head hurts?

EditorData.NodeContext: This is a wild animal and the wrong move might endanger us

Text.Value: No - wait. You smell fresh. Safe. You can stay. If you must.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Combat Idle, Sniffing aorund in the air, Peace Idle (WilsonLee)
EditorData.NodeContext: He's relazed, and wants the player to stay, though he doesn't want to admit it.

Synopsis: An aggravated wolf in a druid grove. He has learned obedience from Rath but is still a wild thing at heart. There are newcomers to his home and his instincts tell him to chase them away, to harm them, but he's not allowed to. He's like a coiled spring, ready to strike.
